content:
Preparing for Einstein Reply Recommendations

Before setting up Einstein Reply Recommendations, review the data requirements and testing tips. Reply recommendations are included in the Service Cloud Einstein add-on license.

Available in: Lightning Experience, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions.

To get started with Einstein Reply Recommendations, Einstein needs at least 1,000 closed chat transcripts in a given language that contain four or more chat turns.

A "turn" is a line in the chat conversation with terms or phrases that can help Einstein learn. If you've enabled bots, Einstein begins counting conversation turns only when an agent joins the chat.

If you don't have enough closed chats, we let you know when you try to build your predictive model. To identify common replies, Einstein can analyze up to 200,000 chat turns from closed chats that have four or more turns, starting with your most recent chats.

Einstein Reply Recommendations supports only unencrypted LiveChatTranscript fields and requires at least 1,000 closed chat transcripts in a given language.

To take reply recommendations for a test run, turn it on in your production org and give a small group of agents access. Choose knowledgeable agents who could answer customer questions without the help of Einstein Reply Recommendations.

If you decide to use reply recommendations in a sandbox, match your sandbox licenses to your production licenses and ensure that your sandbox org's chat transcripts are identical to your production org's.
title: Preparing Einstein Reply Recommendations
